Name: Kushites
History: The Kingdom of Kush was an ancient African kingdom situated on the confluences of the Blue Nile, White Nile and River Atbara in what is now the Republic of Sudan. The Kushite era of rule in the region was established after the Bronze Age collapse of the New Kingdom of Egypt, and it was centered at Napata in its early phase. They invaded Egypt in the 8th century BC, and the Kushite emperors ruled as Pharaohs of the Twenty-fifth dynasty of Egypt for a century, until they were expelled by the Assyrians. Kushite culture was influenced heavily by the Egyptians, with Kushite pyramid building and monumental temple architecture still extent. The Kushites even worshipped many Egyptian gods, including Amun. During Classical antiquity, the Kushite imperial capital was at Meroe. In early Greek geography, the Meroitic kingdom was known as Aethiopia. The Kushite kingdom persisted until the 4th century AD, when it weakened and disintegrated due to internal rebellion, eventually succumbing to the rising power of Axum.

Factions.Name: Kushite Africans
Factions.Description: The great African kingdom that straddled the Nile River in Nubia, in the South of Egypt.

Technologies.Name: Double Edged Axe
Technologies.History: Heavy axe, can crush armor and shields.

Technologies.Name: Monumental Architecture
Technologies.History: The empire of the Nile valley was as great as it had been since the New Empire. New prosperity revived Egyptian culture. Religion, arts and architecture have been restored to their glorious forms of the Old, Middle, and New Empire. It was during the twenty-fifth dynasty that the Nile valley saw the first generalized construction of pyramids since the Middle Kingdom.
Technologies.Description: +25% HP and -50% build time for civic centres, temples, pyramids and wonders.

Technologies.Name: Extraction Control
Technologies.History: The Kushites rulers exercised rigid control over the extraction and trade of minerals, thereby securing their income and power.
Technologies.Description: +5 shuttle capacity of metal and stone.

Technologies.Name: High Priest of Amun
Technologies.History: Have your priests instructed by the High Priest himself - may Amun bless him.
Technologies.Description: Allow to train elite rank healers

Heroes.Name: Nastasen
Heroes.History: Nastasen was a king of the African civilisation of Kush (335 - 315/310 BC). According to a stela from Dongola his mother was named Queen Pelkha and his father may have been King Harsiotef. His successor was Aryamani.

Heroes.Name: Arakamani
Heroes.History: Was a Nubian king of Meroe who ruled in the early third century BCE.

Heroes.Name: Amanirenas
Heroes.History: She reigned from about 40 BC to 10 BC. She is one of the most famous kandakes, because of her role leading Kushite armies against the Romans in a war that lasted five years, from 27 BC to 22 BC. After an initial victory when the Kushites attacked Roman Egypt, they were driven out of Egypt by Gaius Petronius and the Romans established a new frontier at Hiere Sycaminos (Maharraqa). Amanirenas was described as brave, and blind in one eye.

CivBonuses.Name: Skilled Archers
CivBonuses.Description: The Archer's Health +10, and the shooting interval is -10%.

CivBonuses.Name: Economic Pillar
CivBonuses.History: Controlled several trade routes linking the interior of Africa to the Red Sea.
CivBonuses.Description: Can build market and train traders in the village phase.

CivBonuses.Name: Commercial Wealth
CivBonuses.History: While the capital was Napata, the main economic activity of the cuxitas was cattle raising: they raised goats, goats, horses and donkeys (mainly used to transport products). A person's wealth was measured by the size of his flock.
CivBonuses.Description: -50% cost for corral,and start with two goat.

Structures.Name: Temple of Amun
Structures.History: The Temple of Amun is an archaeological site at Jebel Barkal in Northern State, Sudan. It is situated about 400 kilometres north of Khartoum near Karima. The temple stands near a large bend of the Nile River, in the region that was called Nubia in ancient times. The Temple of Amun, one of the largest temples at Jebel Barkal, is considered sacred to the local population. Not only was the Amun temple a main centre of what at one time was considered to be an almost universal religion, but, along with the other archaeological sites at Jebel Barkal, it was representative of the revival of Egyptian religious values. Up to the middle of the 19th century, the temple was subjected to vandalism, destruction, and indiscriminate plundering, before it came under state protection.
Structures.Special: The Kushites can upgrade individual Temples to Temples of Amun, which can train Napatan Temple Guard champions and heal units faster.

Structures.Name: Temple of Apedemak
Structures.History: Is a ruined ancient city of the Kushitic Kingdom of Meroe in modern-day Sudan. The ancient city lies about 170 km north-east of Khartoum, and about 50 km east of the Nile River. Here smaller wadis meet the Wadi Awateib coming from the center of the Butana plateau region, and further north at Wad ban Naqa from where it joins the Nile. Was only a camel or donkey's journey from the Nile, and could serve as a trading station on the way to the east; thus it had strategic importance.
Structures.Special: The Kushites can upgrade individual Temples to Temples of Apedemak, which can train Meroe Temple Guard champions and heal units faster.

Structures.Name: Kushite Pyramids
Structures.History: The Kushites built over 200 pyramids in Nubia.
Structures.Special: Building a Small Kushite Pyramid unlocks the Town Phase. Building a Large Kushite Pyramid unlocks the City Phase. And each pyramid built adds +10% territory effect to Civic Centers.
